a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Proportion of population with basic handwashing facilities, urban vs. rural,
Share of population in urban areas versus rural areas with access to basic handwashing facilities. Basic handwashing facilities are
defined as a device to contain, transport or regulate the flow of water to facilitate handwashing with soap and water in the
Data source: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (JMP)
